data.text: @crazywizdom @anthonydmarek @DrEricDing It’s great that you’re being cautious. When I see people still trying to factor in personal immunity with Covid it raises a red flag, that was my concern with your tweet. It’s impossible to know how each person will respond to infection, anti-vaxxers use this angle far too often
@DrEricDing @vijay27anand Check this. Its BA.2 Subvariant. Not Original BA.2
@Hanksy19 @anthonydmarek @DrEricDing I think you're projecting something onto me. I've been really very cautious throughout this pandemic. I'm trying not to get hysterical though.
@WillDavey2 @donny17234422 @DrEricDing And have been lucky so far.

@WillDavey2 @donny17234422 @DrEricDing I have a job that requires me to be around large groups of people daily, almost everyone of them unmasked. I understand it puts me at greater risk of catching covid, but that's our new reality. I've been around a lot of infected people...

@WillDavey2 @donny17234422 @DrEricDing That's just it: it's never going to be over. We're not going to eradicate this thing. For that reason, it's an individual decision how to proceed and protect yourself. But the days of capacity limits are over.

@KrushCovid @RafaFordB @DrEricDing 45% are not vaxxed and fight it, and we all have an obligation to protect those at high risk. Even those of us who are fully vaxxed. We still need to stand for the right thing. There's no reason covid should be the norm.

@KrushCovid @donny17234422 @DrEricDing As with the last 4 surges, we are less than 5% infection rate, that's when the next variant makes, it's debut for the start of the next surge. BA2 seems to be moving in that direction. Don't let your guard down just yet. It's not over till the fat lady sings!

@NooneIma @DrEricDing Quite relieved to have that second booster( Moderna) 5 months after the Pfizer booster. 10 days before the university dropped masks. I facing 500 students 3x a week. Vaccines plus boosters plus masks feels just fine.
